title: Misleading Splash Arts
body:
I'm tired of splash arts that are amazing as heck but in-game it looks NOWHERE near like it. It's an awesome skin concept but the model just destroys it. :( 
For example,Asylum Shaco
(Asylum Shaco Splash Art has purplish shaggy hair that covers most of the upper face with 1 eye exposed and looks like an **_ACTUAL_** clown)
http://i.imgur.com/GFMvPLb.png
(Asylum Shaco In-game Model has black-bluish hair and looks like a **_HUMAN BEING_** with two eyes exposed)
http://i.imgur.com/nre51Rh.png
Now tell me how they look alike.
(Masked Shaco has a more wilder blu-ish free hair with a bright orange mask)
http://i.imgur.com/pk8oWbg.png
(Masked Shaco In-game Model has a very dark skin tone colored mask with a _**GREY**_ headband,in the splash art it's _**BLACK**_,and the hair looks like it's stuck together with tons of gel)
http://i.imgur.com/GOzwwaw.png

All I'm asking is,can we get some sort of _**visual updates**_ for these skins that actually look like their splash arts? I mean look at the **Asylum Shaco**...

replies.body: Those splash screens are an artists rendition of what Shaco *might* look like. Nobody has ever actually seen Shaco and lived to tell about it.
Shaco has an older model so it's kind of hard for them to make him have some of those features (i.e. Hair) in game.

Have you seen {{champion:9}} classic splash art and compare it to his in-game model? Fiddlesticks gets a new splash art and a new look from Twist of Fates, but his in-game model hasn't been updated since 2011.
